required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluating the Need for the Pseudophakic Intraoperative Abberrometry in Toric IOL Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Need for Pseudophakic Intraoperative Abberrometry in Toric IOL Implantation

lead_sponsor.agency: Alterman, Modi, & Wolter Ophthalmic Physicians & Surgeons

clinical_study.source: Alterman, Modi, & Wolter Ophthalmic Physicians & Surgeons

brief_summary.textblock: To determine clinically significant difference in results obtained from cataract surgery using IA. One eye will receive aphakic measurements only and the fellow eye will receive aphakic and then pseudophakic measurements when implanting a toric IOL.

detailed_description.textblock: To determine if there is a clinically significant difference in the results obtained for the toric IOL implantation when using IA to measure the aphakic eye only and when using IA to measure the aphakic eye and then the pseudophakic eye, with toric IOL implantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant difference in results obtained for tori iol implantation when using IA
primary_outcome.description: Difference in magnitude of residual refractive astigmatism between groups Percentage of eyes with 0.50D or less of postoperative residual refractive astigmatism at 1 month post-op in each sub-group Percentage of eyes within 0.50D of intended spherical equivalent Sub-group analysis: Vector analysis of the effects of any toric IOL realignment suggested by pseudophakic IA (i.e. was it likely to improve or worsen residual refractive astigmatism and/or UCVA)

arm_group.description: Eye measured in aphakic state only

Eye measured in aphakic state then again in pseudophakic state with toric IOL using the ORA System. Pseudophakic measurement obtained will provide data about placement of toric iol and the surgeon will use that data to rotate the iol if necessary.

intervention.description: standard aphakic measurements will be taken and then pseudophakic measurements will be taken after toric iol implantation. The data produced will aid the surgeon in proper placement of toric iol orientation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- willing and able to understand and sign an informed consent
- willing and able to attend all study visits
- presenting for uncomplicated bilateral cataract surgery and have an interest in a toric iol
- have good ocular health, with no pathology that compromises visual acuity (outside of residual refractive error)
- have visually significant cataracts
- have regular corneal astigmatism of 1.0D to 5.0D in both eyes with a difference between eyes of 1.0D or less
- have potential post operative acuity of 20/25 or better
Exclusion Criteria:
- corneal pathology
- amblyopia
- prior corneal refractive surgery or other refractive surgery
- previous anterior or posterior chamber surgery that the investigator feels may compromise visual outcomes
- Diabetic retinopathy if the investigator feels this will compromise visual outcomes
- macular degeneration
- history of retinal detachment
- irregular astigmatism or keratoconus
- strabismus
- if in the surgeon's opinion the subject is not an appropriate candidate for iol implantation
- subjects who have an acute or chronic disease or illness that would confound the results of this investigation

facility.name: Alterman Modi and Wolter Ophthalmic Physicians and Surgeons

patient_data.ipd_description: Results of the study may be shared at international meeting s and submitted for peer review
